00002 * $Id$          rit_interrupt.c                                         2010-05-21

00025 #include "lpc17xx_rit.h"
00026 #include "lpc17xx_libcfg.h"
00027 #include "debug_frmwrk.h"
00028 #include "lpc17xx_gpio.h"
00029 
00030 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00036 /************************** PRIVATE DEFINITIONS ***********************/
00037 #define MCB_LPC_1768
00038 //#define IAR_LPC_1768
00039 
00040 #define TIME_INTERVAL   1000
00041 
00042 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLE ***********************/
00043 uint8_t menu[]=
00044         "********************************************************************************\n\r"
00045         "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00046         " RIT demo \n\r"
00047         "\t - MCU: LPC17xx \n\r"
00048         "\t - Core: ARM CORTEX-M3 \n\r"
00049         "\t - Communicate via: UART0 - 115200 bps \n\r"
00050         " Use RIT as a timer to generate interrupt to turn on/off LED each 1s \n\r"
00051         "********************************************************************************\n\r";
00052 FunctionalState LEDStatus = ENABLE;
00053 
00054 /************************** PRIVATE FUNCTION *************************/
00055 void RIT_IRQHandler(void);
00056 
00057 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00058 /*********************************************************************/
00063 void RIT_IRQHandler(void)
00064 {
00065         RIT_GetIntStatus(LPC_RIT); //call this to clear interrupt flag
00066         if(LEDStatus == ENABLE)
00067         {
00068                 LEDStatus = DISABLE;
00069 #ifdef MCB_LPC_1768
00070                 //turn off LED
00071                 GPIO_ClearValue(2,(1<<2));
00072 #elif defined(IAR_LPC_1768)
00073                 GPIO_SetValue(1,(1<<25));
00074 #endif
00075         }
00076         else
00077         {
00078                 LEDStatus = ENABLE;
00079 #ifdef MCB_LPC_1768
00080                 //turn off LED
00081                 GPIO_SetValue(2,(1<<2));
00082 #elif defined(IAR_LPC_1768)
00083                 GPIO_ClearValue(1,(1<<25));
00084 #endif
00085         }
00086 }
00087 
00088 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00089 /*********************************************************************/
00094 int c_entry (void) {
00095 
00096         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00097          * – 115200bps
00098          * – 8 data bit
00099          * – No parity
00100          * – 1 stop bit
00101          * – No flow control
00102          */
00103         debug_frmwrk_init();
00104          _DBG(menu);
00105 
00106         RIT_Init(LPC_RIT);
00107         /* Configure time_interval for RIT
00108          * In this case: time_interval = 1000 ms = 1s
00109          * So, RIT will generate interrupt each 1s
00110          */
00111         RIT_TimerConfig(LPC_RIT,TIME_INTERVAL);
00112 
00113         _DBG("The time interval is: ");
00114         _DBD32(TIME_INTERVAL); _DBG_(" millisecond..");
00115 
00116 #ifdef MCB_LPC_1768 /* Using LED2.2 for testing */
00117         //turn on LED2.2
00118         FIO_SetDir(2,(1<<2),1);
00119         FIO_SetValue(2,(1<<2));
00120 #elif defined(IAR_LPC_1768) /* Using LED1 (P1.25 for testing */
00121         FIO_SetDir(1,(1<<25),1);
00122         FIO_ClearValue(1,(1<<25));
00123 #endif
00124         NVIC_EnableIRQ(RIT_IRQn);
00125 
00126         while(1);
00127         return 1;
00128 }
00129 
00130 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00131    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00132    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00133    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00134    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00135 int main(void)
00136 {
00137     return c_entry();
00138 }

00140 #ifdef  DEBUG

00142 * @brief                Reports the name of the source file and the source line number
00143 *                               where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.
00144 * @param[in]    file Pointer to the source file name
00145 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00146 * @return               None
00147 *******************************************************************************/
00148 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)
00149 {
00150         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00151          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00152

00154         while(1);
00155 }
